project.teaser: The overall objective of CO-VALUE is to boost uptake and deployment of research results by adopting a co-valorisation approach that strengthens the role of societal actors in knowledge valorisation. Citizen engagement will be embedded in knowledge valorisation by deploying...
project.objective: The overall objective of CO-VALUE is to boost uptake and deployment of research results by adopting a co-valorisation approach that strengthens the role of societal actors in knowledge valorisation. Citizen engagement will be embedded in knowledge valorisation by deploying capacity building, peer learning actions and experimentation. CO-VALUE will capitalise on and contribute to EU initiatives such as the Knowledge Valorisation Platform, through the production, testing and improvement of best practices and lessons learned in two European territories: Alicante in Spain and Emilia Romagna in Italy. In each territory, quadruple-helix stakeholders from the research & innovation ecosystem will be involved in the co-design and implementation of co-valorisation, exploiting ongoing knowledge valorisation processes such as developing innovative solutions to address the lack of raw materials and its impact on citizens welfare (Alicante), or specific funding schemes and projects to introduce multi-stakeholder engagement in public-funded research (Emilia Romagna).The transfer of best practices and skills will be guaranteed by a comprehensive scheme of capacity building, peer learning and shadowing opportunities, both at local and international level. The involvement of umbrella organisations such as EBN, ERRIN and universities alliances will foster a wider uptake of CO-VALUEs trainings and tools, thus supporting the implementation of new practices by knowledge valorisation agents beyond the project consortium. Incentives for researchers to engage with society, and for society to engage with researchers will be co-designed with stakeholders in each territory and implemented throughthe involvement of local R&I public administrations. Tangible changes in local co-valorisation agents will be exploited to showcase improvements, together with a co-assessment of enabling conditions, processes and impact performed together by all stakeholders involved.
project.title: Citizen-Oriented Valorisation for Advancement, Learning and Uptake in Europe
project.keywords: co-creation, co-valorisation, open innovation, knowledge valorisation, experimentation, citizen engagement

article.title: Citizen engagement in knowledge valorisation of research results

result.title: Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication Plan
result.description: A report including the definition of target groups, appropriate dissemination tools and messages, and a timetable of project dissemination and outreach milestones, including a description of events. An updated version will be provided in M22 after the RP1 review meeting.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - CO-VALUE (Citizen-Oriented Valorisation for Advancement, Learning and Uptake in Europe)
result.teaser: Across Europe, research and innovation generate vast amounts of knowledge, yet too often this knowledge does not reach its full potential in society or the economy. Traditional approaches have focused on transferring results from research to industry, but today a broader and...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Policy Brief RP1
result.description: The Policy Brief at each reporting period is an EC requirement. According to the EC template, the policy brief will include an introduction, evidence and analysis, policy implications and recommendations, the research parameters and the identification of the project.

result.title: Modular co-valorisation capacity building and peer learning program
result.description: This report will include the CO-VALUE capacity building and peer learning programme composed of various training modules and peer-learning activities such as shadowing opportunities. The different training modules will include for example SMART objectives, curriculum development, resources, learning outcomes and co-assessment techniques. The modules will include face-to-face and online sessions.

result.title: CO-VALUE experimentation plans of action
result.description: A report on the action plans for the implementation of the co-valorisation activities in Emilia Romagna and Alicante, listing the actions and steps needed to achieve the co-valorisation processess including the plans for co-assessment.

result.title: Self-assessment tool
result.description: The self-assessment tool will support teams in understanding their co-valorisation institutional maturity and define ways to improve their current status. The different sections encourage an in-depth reflection on their present situation, as well as enablers and blockers, as the first step towards formulating co-valorisation plans.

result.title: Project handbook
result.description: The Project handbook will provide the guidelines and directions for all the project partners concerning aspects such as management structures, project reporting, internal communication and other working practices.

result.title: Co-valorisation Canvas
result.description: Canvas outlining CO-VALUE’s consensus on co-valorisation, review of existing materials and shared indicators of success that will support the vision of the project.

result.title: Data Management Plan
result.description: The Data Management Plan is an EC requirement. The EC provides a template for Horizon Europe DMPs which includes the handling of research data during & after the end of the project, what data will be collected, processed and/or generated, which methodology & standards will be applied, whether data will be shared/made open access and, how data will be curated & preserved (including after the end of the project).

result.title: Field guides for co-valorisation experimentation
result.description: The field guide describes the local Co-valorisation processes and includes practical guidance to support the adaptation of Co-valorisation approaches in the local experimentation sites. It will include an online 'development diary’ of the two sites and a short guidance document including agile and modular guidelines for co-valorisation agents.

result.title: Recommendations of incentives for co-valorisation uptake
result.description: This report will include recommendations about the practical incentives to be implemented in each of the two local ecosystems in order to foster a stronger uptake of knowledge co-valorisation. The recommendations on the incentives will be tailored to specificities of the individual 4H stakeholder groups.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
